question: I am more skilled at identifying online scams than the average IIIT student.
My technical background makes me less likely to fall for a sophisticated phishing attempt.
I am confident I can spot a fraudulent email or website in under 10 seconds.
I always know how to verify the sender of a suspicious email.
I can easily tell the difference between a real university announcement and a fake one.
Security warnings on browsers or email clients are mostly for non-technical users.
I am confident in my ability to detect a 'homoglyph' attack (e.g., using different alphabets) in a URL.
I believe my online accounts are well-secured and I am at low risk of being compromised.
I can easily tell when a message is using psychological tricks (like urgency) to make me click.
I have a very good understanding of online security best practices.
